4676.verse-arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالذَّارِيَاتِ ذَرْوًا

clauses-arabic.clause: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالذَّارِيَاتِ ذَرْوًا

4677.verse-english: And those [clouds] carrying a load [of water]

clauses-english.clause: And those [clouds] carrying a load [of water]

4680.verse-english: Indeed, what you are promised is true.

clauses-english.clause: what you are promised is true.

4681.verse-english: And indeed, the recompense is to occur.

4683.verse-english: Indeed, you are in differing speech.

4684.verse-english: Deluded away from the Qur'an is he who is deluded.

clauses-english.clause: Deluded away from the Qur'an is he who is deluded.

4686.verse-english: Who are within a flood [of confusion] and heedless.

clauses-english.clause: Who are within a flood [of confusion] and heedless.

4687.verse-english: They ask, "When is the Day of Recompense?"

4688.verse-english: [It is] the Day they will be tormented over the Fire

clauses-english.clause: [It is] the Day they will be tormented over the Fire

4689.verse-arabic: ذُوقُوا فِتْنَتَكُمْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
4689.verse-english: [And will be told], "Taste your torment. This is that for which you were impatient."

clauses-english.clause: This is that for which you were impatient.

4690.verse-english: Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and springs,

clauses-english.clause: the righteous will be among gardens and springs,

4691.verse-arabic: آخِذِينَ مَا آتَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحْسِنِينَ
4691.verse-english: Accepting what their Lord has given them. Indeed, they were before that doers of good.

clauses-english.clause: Accepting what their Lord has given them.
they were before that doers of good.

4692.verse-arabic: كَانُوا قَلِيلًا مِّنَ اللَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ
4692.verse-english: They used to sleep but little of the night,

clauses-arabic.clause: كَانُوا قَلِيلًا مِّنَ اللَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ

clauses-english.clause: They used to sleep but little of the night,

4693.verse-english: And in the hours before dawn they would ask forgiveness,

clauses-english.clause: And in the hours before dawn they would ask forgiveness,

4694.verse-english: And from their properties was [given] the right of the [needy] petitioner and the deprived.

clauses-english.clause: And from their properties was [given] the right of the [needy] petitioner and the deprived.

4695.verse-english: And on the earth are signs for the certain [in faith]

clauses-english.clause: And on the earth are signs for the certain [in faith]

4696.verse-english: And in yourselves. Then will you not see?

4697.verse-english: And in the heaven is your provision and whatever you are promised.

clauses-english.clause: And in the heaven is your provision and whatever you are promised.

4698.verse-arabic: فَوَرَبِّ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ إِنَّهُ لَحَقٌّ مِّثْلَ مَا أَنَّكُمْ تَنطِقُونَ
4698.verse-english: Then by the Lord of the heaven and earth, indeed, it is truth - just as [sure as] it is that you are speaking.

clauses-english.clause: Then by the Lord of the heaven and earth,
just as [sure as] it is that you are speaking.

4699.verse-arabic: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيْفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ الْمُكْرَمِينَ
4699.verse-english: Has there reached you the story of the honored guests of Abraham? -

clauses-english.clause: Has there reached you the story of the honored guests of Abraham?

4700.verse-arabic: إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا سَلَامًا ۖ قَالَ سَلَامٌ قَوْمٌ مُّنكَرُونَ
4700.verse-english: When they entered upon him and said, "[We greet you with] peace." He answered, "[And upon you] peace, [you are] a people unknown.

clauses-english.clause: When they entered upon him and said,

4701.verse-arabic: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِ فَجَاءَ بِعِجْلٍ سَمِينٍ
4701.verse-english: Then he went to his family and came with a fat [roasted] calf

clauses-arabic.clause: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِ فَجَاءَ بِعِجْلٍ سَمِينٍ

clauses-english.clause: Then he went to his family and came with a fat [roasted] calf

4702.verse-english: And placed it near them; he said, "Will you not eat?"

4703.verse-arabic: فَأَوْجَسَ مِنْهُمْ خِيفَةً ۖ قَالُوا لَا تَخَفْ ۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَامٍ عَلِيمٍ
4703.verse-english: And he felt from them apprehension. They said, "Fear not," and gave him good tidings of a learned boy.

clauses-english.clause: And he felt from them apprehension.
" and gave him good tidings of a learned boy.

4704.verse-arabic: فَأَقْبَلَتِ امْرَأَتُهُ فِي صَرَّةٍ فَصَكَّتْ وَجْهَهَا وَقَالَتْ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٌ
4704.verse-english: And his wife approached with a cry [of alarm] and struck her face and said, "[I am] a barren old woman!"

clauses-english.clause: And his wife approached with a cry [of alarm] and struck her face and said,

4705.verse-arabic: قَالُوا كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْحَكِيمُ الْعَلِيمُ
4705.verse-english: They said, "Thus has said your Lord; indeed, He is the Wise, the Knowing."

4706.verse-english: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"

4707.verse-arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّا أُرْسِلْنَا إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ مُّجْرِمِينَ
4707.verse-english: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals

clauses-english.clause: we have been sent to a people of criminals

4708.verse-english: To send down upon them stones of clay,

clauses-english.clause: To send down upon them stones of clay,

4709.verse-english: Marked in the presence of your Lord for the transgressors."

clauses-english.clause: Marked in the presence of your Lord for the transgressors.

4710.verse-arabic: فَأَخْرَجْنَا مَن كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
4710.verse-english: So We brought out whoever was in the cities of the believers.

clauses-arabic.clause: فَأَخْرَجْنَا مَن كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

clauses-english.clause: So We brought out whoever was in the cities of the believers.

4711.verse-arabic: فَمَا وَجَدْنَا فِيهَا غَيْرَ بَيْتٍ مِّنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ
4711.verse-english: And We found not within them other than a [single] house of Muslims.

clauses-arabic.clause: فَمَا وَجَدْنَا فِيهَا غَيْرَ بَيْتٍ مِّنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ

clauses-english.clause: And We found not within them other than a [single] house of Muslims.

4712.verse-arabic: وَتَرَكْنَا فِيهَا آيَةً لِّلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ
4712.verse-english: And We left therein a sign for those who fear the painful punishment.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَتَرَكْنَا فِيهَا آيَةً لِّلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ

clauses-english.clause: And We left therein a sign for those who fear the painful punishment.

4713.verse-arabic: وَفِي مُوسَىٰ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَاهُ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ بِسُلْطَانٍ مُّبِينٍ
4713.verse-english: And in Moses [was a sign], when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority.

clauses-english.clause: when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority.

4714.verse-arabic: فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكْنِهِ وَقَالَ سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ
4714.verse-english: But he turned away with his supporters and said," A magician or a madman."

clauses-english.clause: But he turned away with his supporters and said,

4715.verse-arabic: فَأَخَذْنَاهُ وَجُنُودَهُ فَنَبَذْنَاهُمْ فِي الْيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٌ
4715.verse-english: So We took him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea, and he was blameworthy.

clauses-english.clause: So We took him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea,

4716.verse-arabic: وَفِي عَادٍ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ الرِّيحَ الْعَقِيمَ
4716.verse-english: And in 'Aad [was a sign], when We sent against them the barren wind.

clauses-english.clause: when We sent against them the barren wind.

4717.verse-arabic: مَا تَذَرُ مِن شَيْءٍ أَتَتْ عَلَيْهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتْهُ كَالرَّمِيمِ
4717.verse-english: It left nothing of what it came upon but that it made it like disintegrated ruins.

clauses-arabic.clause: مَا تَذَرُ مِن شَيْءٍ أَتَتْ عَلَيْهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتْهُ كَالرَّمِيمِ

clauses-english.clause: It left nothing of what it came upon but that it made it like disintegrated ruins.

4718.verse-arabic: وَفِي ثَمُودَ إِذْ قِيلَ لَهُمْ تَمَتَّعُوا حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
4718.verse-english: And in Thamud, when it was said to them, "Enjoy yourselves for a time."

clauses-english.clause: when it was said to them,

4719.verse-arabic: فَعَتَوْا عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّاعِقَةُ وَهُمْ يَنظُرُونَ
4719.verse-english: But they were insolent toward the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them while they were looking on.

clauses-english.clause: But they were insolent toward the command of their Lord,
so the thunderbolt seized them while they were looking on.

4720.verse-arabic: فَمَا اسْتَطَاعُوا مِن قِيَامٍ وَمَا كَانُوا مُنتَصِرِينَ
4720.verse-english: And they were unable to arise, nor could they defend themselves.

clauses-english.clause: And they were unable to arise,

4721.verse-arabic: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِّن قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ
4721.verse-english: And [We destroyed] the people of Noah before; indeed, they were a people defiantly disobedient.

clauses-english.clause: And [We destroyed] the people of Noah before;
they were a people defiantly disobedient.

4722.verse-english: And the heaven We constructed with strength, and indeed, We are [its] expander.

clauses-english.clause: And the heaven We constructed with strength,

4723.verse-english: And the earth We have spread out, and excellent is the preparer.

clauses-english.clause: And the earth We have spread out,

4724.verse-arabic: وَمِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقْنَا زَوْجَيْنِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ
4724.verse-english: And of all things We created two mates; perhaps you will remember.

clauses-english.clause: And of all things We created two mates;

4725.verse-arabic: فَفِرُّوا إِلَى اللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
4725.verse-english: So flee to Allah. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.

clauses-english.clause: I am to you from Him a clear warner.

4726.verse-arabic: وَلَا تَجْعَلُوا مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
4726.verse-english: And do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.

clauses-english.clause: And do not make [as equal] with God another deity.
I am to you from Him a clear warner.

4727.verse-arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ مَا أَتَى الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُوا سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ
4727.verse-english: Similarly, there came not to those before them any messenger except that they said, "A magician or a madman."

clauses-english.clause: there came not to those before them any messenger except that they said,

4728.verse-arabic: أَتَوَاصَوْا بِهِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ
4728.verse-english: Did they suggest it to them? Rather, they [themselves] are a transgressing people.

clauses-english.clause: Did they suggest it to them?

4729.verse-english: So leave them, [O Muhammad], for you are not to be blamed.

clauses-english.clause: for you are not to be blamed.

4730.verse-english: And remind, for indeed, the reminder benefits the believers.

4731.verse-arabic: وَمَا خَلَقْتُ الْجِنَّ وَالْإِنسَ إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُونِ
4731.verse-english: And I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَمَا خَلَقْتُ الْجِنَّ وَالْإِنسَ إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُونِ

clauses-english.clause: And I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.

4732.verse-arabic: مَا أُرِيدُ مِنْهُم مِّن رِّزْقٍ وَمَا أُرِيدُ أَن يُطْعِمُونِ
4732.verse-english: I do not want from them any provision, nor do I want them to feed Me.

clauses-english.clause: I do not want from them any provision,
nor do I want them to feed Me.

4733.verse-arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الرَّزَّاقُ ذُو الْقُوَّةِ الْمَتِينُ
4733.verse-english: Indeed, it is Allah who is the [continual] Provider, the firm possessor of strength.

clauses-english.clause: it is God who is the [continual] Provider,

4734.verse-arabic: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا ذَنُوبًا مِّثْلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصْحَابِهِمْ فَلَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونِ
4734.verse-english: And indeed, for those who have wronged is a portion [of punishment] like the portion of their predecessors, so let them not impatiently urge Me.

clauses-english.clause: for those who have wronged is a portion [of punishment] like the portion of their predecessors,
so let them not impatiently urge Me.

4735.verse-arabic: فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِن يَوْمِهِمُ الَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
4735.verse-english: And woe to those who have disbelieved from their Day which they are promised.

clauses-arabic.clause: فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِن يَوْمِهِمُ الَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ

clauses-english.clause: And woe to those who have disbelieved from their Day which they are promised.
